memberdef.name: Poisson_reconstruction_function

briefdescription.para: iterator over the first input point.
past-the-end iterator over the input points.
property map: value_type of InputIterator -> Point (the position of an input point).
property map: value_type of InputIterator -> Vector (the oriented normal of an input point).
Creates a Poisson implicit function from the range of points [first, beyond).

parameterdescription.para: is a model of ReadablePropertyMap with a value_type = Point. It can be omitted if InputIterator value_type is convertible to Point.
is a model of ReadablePropertyMap with a value_type = Vector.

briefdescription.para: Returns a sphere bounding the inferred surface.
This function must be called after the insertion of oriented points.

detaileddescription.para: It computes the piecewise linear scalar function operator() by: applying Delaunay refinement, solving for operator() at each vertex of the triangulation with a sparse linear solver, and shifting and orienting operator() such that it is 0 at all input points and negative inside the inferred surface.

parameterdescription.para: Symmetric definite positive sparse linear solver. If Eigen 3.1 (or greater) is available and CGAL_EIGEN3_ENABLED is defined, an overload with Eigen_solver_traits<Eigen::ConjugateGradient<Eigen_sparse_symmetric_matrix<double>::EigenType> > as default solver is provided.
controls if the Delaunay refinement is done for the input points, or for an approximation of the surface obtained from a first pass of the algorithm on a sample of the points.

simplesect.para: false if the linear solver fails.

briefdescription.para: ImplicitFunction interface: evaluates the implicit function at a given 3D query point.

detaileddescription.para: The function compute_implicit_function() must be called before the first call to operator().

briefdescription.para: Returns a point located inside the inferred surface.

briefdescription.para: Computes enlarged geometric bounding sphere of the embedded triangulation.
Implementation of the Poisson Surface Reconstruction method.

detaileddescription.para: Given a set of 3D points with oriented normals sampled on the boundary of a 3D solid, the Poisson Surface Reconstruction method [2] solves for an approximate indicator function of the inferred solid, whose gradient best matches the input normals. The output scalar function, represented in an adaptive octree, is then iso-contoured using an adaptive marching cubes.
Poisson_reconstruction_function implements a variant of this algorithm which solves for a piecewise linear function on a 3D Delaunay triangulation instead of an adaptive octree.
